On 12/19/06, R. Ramkumar <andyetitmoves@gmail.com> wrote:
>
> add-to-list is a function which you have used in the code u pasted...
> i meant add the lisp code before that... (just a diagnostic.. u can
> remove it off after that)


I assumed add-hook is equivalent to add-to-list and added:

(or (featurep 'ruby-mode) (message "ruby mode is not
loaded as yet"))

just before add-hook. Just as you said, the ruby-mode is not loaded yet. So
I put the initialization lines between

(autoload 'ruby-mode "ruby-mode")
(eval-after-load "ruby-mode" '(progn
 &
))

After doing this I dont get the error/warning. But still the syntax
highlighting does not work. When I open a .rb file, the mode is still
'Fundamental'. In fact, after getting my .emacs file to load successfully,
xemacs21 too does not do syntax highlighting for .rb files! It was doing
fine without the .emacs file (only for .rb files not for rail's .rhtml
files). So, having my own .emacs is clobbering the pre-built support for
ruby in xemacs21 (installed via apt-get from Ubuntu). Emacs22 is
consistently not doing any syntax highlighting for .rb files (and .rhtml
files) - though it does for html/xml, .js (treats .js as java files!) files.

Another question: How do I change the syntax colouring? The default in
xemacs for ruby can barely be called 'highlighting'!!!

Thanks,
mano

> Message: 1
> Date: Mon, 18 Dec 2006 18:01:39 +0530
> From: R.Ramkumar <andyetitmoves@gmail.com>
> Subject: [Ilugc] pthreads and nptl
> To: ILUG-C <ilugc@ae.iitm.ac.in>
> Message-ID:
> 	<9a9bfc170612180431m2daebe8ehc6600be2da76ead5@mail.gmail.com>
> Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
>
> Hi!
>
> I have nptl support in the kernel.. Which is the right way to make
> sure gcc uses this for all apps? getconf GNU_LIBPTHREAD_VERSION
> returns "NPTL 2.3.6", but the apps seem to be getting linked against
> libraries in /usr/lib, and includes in /usr/include. Some non posix
> functions and (I presume the nptl implementation) can be found only in
> /usr/lib/nptl and /usr/include/nptl. I tried to hack around by asking
> a library to use the corresponding -L and -I flags, but it looks like
> I have to reconfigure and recompile every app from scratch to do
> this... Any way gcc can do this by itself? It seems natural for me
> that pthreads should use those directories when indeed getconf returns
> NPTL. Am I going wrong somewhere?
>
> Btw, I use Debian Testing. linux 2.6.16-beyond2. gcc 4.1.2. glibc 2.3.6.
>
> (The library which happened to need the np functions
> (pthread_attr_setaffinity_np) was evas with threaded rendering
> support)
>
> it moves on...
>
> --
> One of the main causes of the fall of the Roman Empire
> was that, lacking zero, they had no way to indicate
> successful termination of their C programs.
>                              -- Robert Firth

> Message: 6
> Date: Mon, 18 Dec 2006 22:45:30 +0530
> From: Mano <manokaran@gmail.com>
> Subject: [Ilugc] emacs help
> To: ILUG-C <ilugc@ae.iitm.ac.in>
> Message-ID:
> 	<7bf1bec50612180915t72635d51w59b289200995d0be@mail.gmail.com>
> Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
>
> Hi,
>
> I have xemacs21 (and also emacs-22.0.90..) on my system. Am trying to get
> the rails mode installed. I followed the instructions as found at
> http://blog.katipo.co.nz/?p=21
>
> To summarize, I have installed ruby1.8-elisp, ecb, emacs-rails, snippet.el,
> find-recursive.el and have copied them to the relevant site-lisp directory.
> My .emacs file looks like this:
>
> ______________________________________________
> (add-hook 'ruby-mode-hook
> (lambda()
> (add-hook 'local-write-file-hooks
> '(lambda()
> (save-excursion
> (untabify (point-min) (point-max))
> (delete-trailing-whitespace)
> )))
> (set (make-local-variable 'indent-tabs-mode) 'nil)
> (set (make-local-variable 'tab-width) 2)
> (imenu-add-to-menubar "IMENU")
> (require 'ruby-electric)
> (ruby-electric-mode t)
> ))
> (defun try-complete-abbrev (old)
> (if (expand-abbrev) t nil))
>
> (setq hippie-expand-try-functions-list
> '(try-complete-abbrev
> try-complete-file-name
> try-expand-dabbrev))
>
> (require 'rails)
>
> ;; If you want to use Mongrel instead of WEBrick, add this to you .emacs
> file:
> ; (setq rails-use-mongrel t)
> ______________________________________________
>
> Now when I start emacs I get this error:
> Symbol's value as variable is void: ?ruby-mode-hook
>
> What could be the reason? How can I rectify this?
>
> Thanks,
> mano
>
>
> ------------------------------
>
> Message: 7
> Date: Mon, 18 Dec 2006 22:55:20 +0530
> From: R.Ramkumar <andyetitmoves@gmail.com>
> Subject: Re: [Ilugc] emacs help
> To: ILUG-C <ilugc@ae.iitm.ac.in>
> Message-ID:
> 	<9a9bfc170612180925i8157c6dvf0764feafc86e8c9@mail.gmail.com>
> Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
>
> > Now when I start emacs I get this error:
> > Symbol's value as variable is void: ?ruby-mode-hook
>
> looks like ruby-mode is not installed when the add-to-list is
> eval'd... do a (or (featurep 'ruby-mode) (message "ruby mode is not
> loaded as yet")) just before the add-to-list to confirm (replace
> 'ruby-mode with whatever the main ruby mode file provides... i havent
> used this mode)
>
> two options:
>
> 1. (require 'ruby-mode) before evaling anything.
>
> for quicker startup...
>
> 2. (autoload 'ruby-mode "ruby-mode") ;; Replace string with actual
> file name, may be u have already something of this sort / package has
> done that for you..
>     (eval-after-load "ruby-mode"
>       '(progn
>          ;; All you ruby-mode init code goes here
>        ))
>
> it moves on...
>
> --
> One of the main causes of the fall of the Roman Empire
> was that, lacking zero, they had no way to indicate
> successful termination of their C programs.
>                              -- Robert Firth
>
>
> ------------------------------

From andyetitmoves at gmail.com  Tue Dec 19 15:30:55 2006
From: andyetitmoves at gmail.com (R.Ramkumar)
Date: Tue Dec 19 15:31:03 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] emacs help
In-Reply-To: <7bf1bec50612182053g3eb92831h74815085af82b379@mail.gmail.com>
References: <7bf1bec50612180915t72635d51w59b289200995d0be@mail.gmail.com>
	<9a9bfc170612180925i8157c6dvf0764feafc86e8c9@mail.gmail.com>
	<7bf1bec50612181024y1420fc78ha97e8c57d096e3f5@mail.gmail.com>
	<9a9bfc170612181041m2fcbd3f0l5a726187d7ccf4cf@mail.gmail.com>
	<7bf1bec50612182053g3eb92831h74815085af82b379@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <9a9bfc170612190200y4bbec82akd8e356850fbcc7b3@mail.gmail.com>

> After doing this I dont get the error/warning. But still the syntax
> highlighting does not work. When I open a .rb file, the mode is still
> 'Fundamental'. In fact, after getting my .emacs file to load successfully,

ah.. looks like you haven't setup for ruby-mode to be used for .rb
files (this instruction is usually given in the README/lisp file...
debian packages set it up themselves on package installation)

add this somewhere to ur .emacs

(add-to-list 'auto-mode-alist '("\\.r\\(b\\|html\\)$" . ruby-mode))

> Another question: How do I change the syntax colouring? The default in
> xemacs for ruby can barely be called 'highlighting'!!!

1. check if you have font-lock-mode enabled (most probably u have it
on if you have *some* highlighting)

2. customize the variable `font-lock-maximum-decoration' to set to
maximum decoration, the value for which is `t'

use M-x customize-variable font-lock-maximum-decoration

3. check the faces (description of font/colors/sizes etc). most of the
defaults are sane, but there may be one or two faces which look the
same.

easiest way to customize them all is to use

M-x customize-group font-lock-faces

4. check the customization group for the package.. M-x customize-group
ruby-<tab>
(not really sure what the group names would be... tab completion
should help) check if there are any fontification related customizable
variables and faces. a rare screwed up package could have bypassed
font-lock and implemented their own fontification, in which case the
first three steps would not hold..

if all this fails, and the package uses font-lock (99.99% it would
be), you can customize font-lock-keywords to provide the fanciest
syntax highlighting possible, but i am not going to tell you how :p
its a bit complex, you would be better off looking at other
alternatives or paining the author to improve the mode.

i haven't used ruby, but i hear the syntax is very similar to perl..
may be try using cperl-mode (comes shipped with emacs these days)...
that has more fontification (provided you ask it for that) than you
would ever need in your entire life :) and is considered by many as
one of the most user-friendly packages around (get to know the
package, and you will know why :) )

it moves on...

-- 
One of the main causes of the fall of the Roman Empire
was that, lacking zero, they had no way to indicate
successful termination of their C programs.
                             -- Robert Firth

On 12/17/06, ?.??????? <shriramadhas@gmail.com> wrote:
>
> > 1. Translating the existing content to Tamil - Is there any free tools
> > that can translate sentences/paragraphs from english to tamil. Is manual
> > translation the only option
>
> KBabel is the commonly used tool with built in dictionary facilities. The
> advantage over here is that once your load the pre-translated .po files to
> the dictionary and then u take a new file for translation, u can do a
> fuzzy
> translation which will substitute existing Tamil words from dictionary.
> You
> can chose to confirm it. For un - available words we can do the
> translation
> and add them to dictionary again.
>
> > 2. Typing the tamil content using an editor, with appropriate Tamil
> > Fonts. (Is there any standard Tamil fonts available). I find no
> > standard/pattern fonts used, just like we normally use Times New Roman
> and
> > Arial in English. I guess we can always ask them to download fonts from
> the
> > webpage, but then ...
>
> Well if we use Unicode, there isn't need for downloading fonts and its
> enough if the browser supports UTF-8 encoding. Try Ubuntu.
> https://wiki.ubuntu.com/TamilTeam/Ubuntu_Tamil_Howto
>
> >Also, is there any tools available which can make it easier to type
> >out the tamil content, even if we are not conversant with Tamil keyboard
> >layout. like 'k letter in English' representing 'ka' in tamil.
>
> SCIM input method comes with Phonetic keyboard layout.  The wiki page
> addressed above has details of packages  that need to be installed for
> this
> purpose.
>

From linux at frodo.hserus.net  Wed Dec 20 08:40:14 2006
From: linux at frodo.hserus.net (Suresh Ramasubramanian)
Date: Wed Dec 20 08:41:26 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] [OT] moving to chennai - manapakkam
In-Reply-To: <d2a92d610612191048i51e9e974tfbba0ca97d4a3595@mail.gmail.com>
References: <d2a92d610612182135j3885b18at3450f42449e9205f@mail.gmail.com>	<413864.13723.qm@web90505.mail.mud.yahoo.com>	<dfa0f0b60612190932s6cd53850v9557d56990a69005@mail.gmail.com>

Binand Sethumadhavan wrote:
> On 19/12/06, lyric hartley <leeslist@gmail.com> wrote:
>> pricing...that is why I am looking into it...any idea what the
>> turn-around time is on getting a frig. cooktop, beds, etc. into the
>> flat? I will arrive 2 wks before my wife and kids...and would like it
>> to be as done as possible before they arrive
> 
> Most local dealers would give you a free home delivery same day or
> worst case, next day.

A gas connection (aka a contract to buy bottled butane/propane mix)
takes rather longer, and has more paperwork for you to do.

Would suggest you ask your friend if he has one to spare, that'd be the
best [they require a bunch of ID, lots of red tape if you need a fresh one].

As for the rest (milk, papers etc) the local people supplying that will
turn up all by themselves within a day or so of your moving in. Do check
if your place has broadband near it though - or you could just buy a
datacard (kind of like verizon's aircard) from one of several local
mobile phone providers, just for home use.

	srs

References: <d2a92d610612182135j3885b18at3450f42449e9205f@mail.gmail.com>	<413864.13723.qm@web90505.mail.mud.yahoo.com>	<dfa0f0b60612190932s6cd53850v9557d56990a69005@mail.gmail.com>	<d2a92d610612191048i51e9e974tfbba0ca97d4a3595@mail.gmail.com>
	<4588A996.4080402@frodo.hserus.net>
Message-ID: <4588AE8E.3020205@symonds.net>

Suresh Ramasubramanian wrote:

> A gas connection (aka a contract to buy bottled butane/propane mix)
> takes rather longer, and has more paperwork for you to do.
> 
> Would suggest you ask your friend if he has one to spare, that'd be the
> best [they require a bunch of ID, lots of red tape if you need a fresh one].

I think that new gas connection from Indane, HP and Bharat gas are now
available for only who have a ration card. I heard that Tamil Nadu
government is strictly enforcing this as there is a subside for the gas.
In other words, a person without a ration card is not going to get gas
connection from these agencies. He has to go for private gas like Spic
Jyothi, etc which is costlier by 150+ INR. This rule is already in
Bangalore (Karnataka). I heard that it is now enforced in Chennai as well.

Regards -
Praveen.

Message-ID: <4588C35B.4050800@gmail.com>

lyric hartley wrote:
> hummm...that does not sound too good...is setting up the gas something
> that has to be done in person? can i start the process remotely or
> have someone one start it?
If you are going for private connection, then the procedures/formalities 
might be a little lenient, especially if they know you are moving in 
from foreign country. Ask your friend to contact the private agent and 
ask about it.

> about the broadband, i was told that airtel should be available...I
> recall a post recently about bsnl increaseing bandwidth...any
> suggestions on isps (preferably linux and server friendly, not sure if
> it is an issue there like it can be here, port blocking etc.)...what
> is a reasonable turn-around on broadband setup...here, it can take a
> few weeks on a new account
BSNL Broadband will be surely available, it is there even in a village 
20 Kms off chengelpet and hence, manapakkam shouldn't be a problem. 
Also, as far as BSNL you can get both the telephone connection as well 
as Braodband (which is true to other Private providers also). It is 
comparatively cheap such that Telephone+Internet might cost you around 
1500 Rs per month ( Plan Unlimited Broadband 900 INR per month + 
Telephone Landline Plan which depends on your corresponding plan). And, 
BSNL wont 99% say they wont give you a conenction if it is in a remote 
area. If you can take care of the line man ( ;-) ) then you can get the 
connection ASAP.
> 
> same basic questions about mobile phone setup
> 
> how do the prices I see on the websites mentioned compare to the ones
> I would get in a store (also whatever "being western" increase etc.)?
> 
There are quite a  lot of Mobile Phone service providers in India and 
you can select a suitable one depending on the plan and prices that will 
suit you. The best ones for Chennai/Tamil Nadu is Airtel and Aircel.

> thanks a lot you guys...it is very very helpful!

You are always welcome :)

On 20-Dec-06, at 10:16 AM, lyric hartley wrote:

> same basic questions about mobile phone setup

mobile phone requires identity and address proof - also a stamp sized  
photo.
>
> how do the prices I see on the websites mentioned compare to the ones
> I would get in a store (also whatever "being western" increase etc.)?

prices on websites are 'MRP' or list prices. Street prices are  
different and increase if you are a foreigner or dont know tamil. Go  
to a big shop for appliances. Brands are LG, Godrej, Bosch, Samsung.  
Bargain - you are expected to. (hint: ask for a discount). If you buy  
everything in one shop, insist on free delivery. If they charge for  
delivery, tell them to add the charge to your bill. Most shops will  
send the company representative to install the appliance and give you  
the warranty card. The company rep will turn up a day or two after  
delivery.

-- 

regards
kg
http://lawgon.livejournal.com
http://nrcfosshelpline.in/web/

Parthan wrote:
> If you are going for private connection, then the procedures/formalities
> might be a little lenient, especially if they know you are moving in
> from foreign country. Ask your friend to contact the private agent and
> ask about it.

bah, just ask your friend if he has a spare connection [in his name]
that he can let you have.. that should be reasonable.  If not - like
others have said, there are some private providers

>> about the broadband, i was told that airtel should be available...I
>> recall a post recently about bsnl increaseing bandwidth...any

Airtel's just fine - 512k bandwidth tops though, not 2 mbps. And its
metered (1 to 3 gigs transfer cap a month, so slow down on the p2p and
linux image ftp'ing .. there's a well developed sneakernet here) :)

> There are quite a  lot of Mobile Phone service providers in India and
> you can select a suitable one depending on the plan and prices that will
> suit you. The best ones for Chennai/Tamil Nadu is Airtel and Aircel.

Airtel, Hutch, etc - lots of them around. Hutch is a bit neater / more
professional than airtel is, I've found.  Make sure your phone is
tri-band GSM, by the way - or you can pick up nokias or whatever for
quite cheap here.

On Tue, Dec 19, 2006 at 11:46:44PM -0500, lyric hartley wrote:
> hummm...that does not sound too good...is setting up the gas something
> that has to be done in person? can i start the process remotely or
> have someone one start it?
> about the broadband, i was told that airtel should be available...I
> recall a post recently about bsnl increaseing bandwidth...any
> suggestions on isps (preferably linux and server friendly, not sure if
> it is an issue there like it can be here, port blocking etc.)...what
> is a reasonable turn-around on broadband setup...here, it can take a
> few weeks on a new account
> 
> same basic questions about mobile phone setup
> 
> how do the prices I see on the websites mentioned compare to the ones
> I would get in a store (also whatever "being western" increase etc.)?
> 
> thanks a lot you guys...it is very very helpful!

I find that people are doing their best to help you out in whatever manner possible.

But all I have to say is "just come, let us take care of the rest as things come."

Just play by the ear. Different ppl will always have different perspectives and it will be hard for you to decide which way to go.

Just come with some uncertainty and enjoy the experience.

India is very different today. But for the infamous gas connection, you can buy anything and everything with money.

And you can theoretically buy an electric stove and cook too...

And ppl are very professional in Chennai and extremely fast too.

So don't get worried. All will be well.

People in general don't cheat here just because you are a foreigner. If you have an idea about the rates and show that you are not gullible people will immediately start making sense.

There are so many foreign students studying in IIT Madras and other foreigners working in IT companies in Chennai and Blore. If you really feel like I could put you in touch with them, but I doubt if you need that.

All the best!

We are looking fwd to meeting you in Chennai ASAP!

regards,
Girish

use the windows driver itself.

On 20/12/06, Girish Venkatachalam <girishvenkatachalam@gmail.com> wrote:
> India is very different today. But for the infamous gas connection, you can buy anything and everything with money.

I have my doubts about this. The last time I applied for a gas
connection (Indane, Hyderabad, 2002), it was a one-afternoon job. A
letter from my employer (residence proof), a copy of my driving
license (id proof), some money (I think around Rs. 800 - deposit) and
I had a connection. They asked me to take my first cylinder along with
me, with a promise of home delivery from the second cylinder onwards.

> People in general don't cheat here just because you are a foreigner.

So very true. Chennaiites are used to having non-Indians around,
unlike certain other places I could mention.

Binand

From sivaein at gmail.com  Wed Dec 20 14:14:29 2006

Subject: [Ilugc] urgent help needed.
In-Reply-To: <1c81e6720612192211j3a897dbeh7a50535fd9b9c83f@mail.gmail.com>

Hi,
      If you umount (unmount) the per drive, u can eject. But i can't get
your exact doubt.
      AND
      Most of the laptop with Linux it would not support wireless. But we
can enable wireless using ndiswrapper. It means we can load windows driver
into linux system. (but not by installation)
    Ref: http://wiki.linuxquestions.org/wiki/NDIS_Wrapper

Sivakumar
Chennai

On 12/20/06, Bruce Mathew <brucemathew@gmail.com> wrote:
>
> Dear friends
>

   lyric hartley wrote:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > hummm...that does not sound too good...is setting up the gas something                                                                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > that has to be done in person? can i start the process remotely or                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > have someone one start it?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   If you are going for private connection, then the procedures/formalities                                                                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   might be a little lenient, especially if they know you are moving in                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   from foreign country. Ask your friend to contact the private agent and                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   ask about it.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > about the broadband, i was told that airtel should be available...I                                                                                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > recall a post recently about bsnl increaseing bandwidt! h...any                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > suggestions on isps (preferably linux and server f riendly, not sure if                                                                                                                                                                                                       
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > it is an issue there like it can be here, port blocking etc.)...what                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > is a reasonable turn-around on broadband setup...here, it can take a                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > few weeks on a new account                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   BSNL Broadband will be surely available, it is there even in a village                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   20 Kms off chengelpet and hence, manapakkam shouldn't be a problem.                                                                                                                                                                                                             
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   Also, as far as BSNL you can get both the telephone connection as well                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   as Braodband (which is true to other Private providers also). It is                                                                                                                                                                                                             
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   comparatively cheap such that Telephone+Internet might cost you around                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   1500 Rs per month ( Plan Unlimited Broadband 900 INR per month +                                                                                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   Telephone Landline Plan which depends on your corresponding plan). And,                                                                                                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   BSNL wont 99% say they wont give you a conenction if it is in a remote                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   area. If you can take care of the line man ( ;-) ) then you can get the                                                                                                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   connection ASAP.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   >                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > same basic questi! ons about mobile phone setup                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   >                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > how do the prices I see on the websites mentioned compare to the ones                                                                                                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > I would get in a store (also whatever "being western" increase etc.)?                                                                                                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   >                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   There are quite a lot of Mobile Phone service providers in India and                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   you can select a suitable one depending on the plan and prices that will                                                                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   suit you. The best ones for Chennai/Tamil Nadu is Airtel and Aircel.                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > thanks a lot you guys...it is very very helpful!

   Message: 4                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   Date: Wed, 20 Dec 2006 10:47:45 +0530                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   From: Kenneth Gonsalves <lawgon@thenilgiri! s.com>                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   Subject: Re: [Ilugc] [OT] moving to chennai - manapakkam                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   To: ILUG-C <ilugc@ae.iitm.ac.in>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   Message-ID: <6CA8FEA3-ADD0-4640-B0F3-21037655D59E@thenilgiris.com>                                                                                                                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII; delsp=yes; format=flowed                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   On 20-Dec-06, at 10:16 AM, lyric hartley wrote:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > same basic questions about mobile phone setup                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   mobile phone requires identity and address proof - also a stamp sized                                                                                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   photo.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   >                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > how do the prices I see on the websites mentioned compare to the ones                                                                                                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > I would get in a store (also whatever "being western" increase etc.)?                                                                                                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   prices on websites are 'MRP' or list prices. Street prices are                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   different and increase if you are a foreigner or dont know tamil. Go                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   to a big shop for appliances. Brands are LG, Godrej, Bosch, Samsung.                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   Bargain - you are expected to. (hint: ask for a discount). If you buy                                                                                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   everything in one shop, insist on free delivery. If they! charge for                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   delivery, tell them to add the charge to your bill. Most shops will                                                                                                                                                                                                             
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   send the company representative to install the appliance and give you                                                                                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   the warranty card. The company rep will turn up a day or two after                                                                                                                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   delivery.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   --                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   regards                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   kg                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   http://lawgon.livejournal.com

   > from foreign country.    bah, just ask your friend if he has a spare connection [in his name]                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   that he can let you have.. that should be reasonable. If not - like                                                                                                                                                                                                             
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   others have said, there are some private providers                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   >> about the broadband, i was told that airtel should be available...I                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   >> recall a post recently about bsnl increaseing bandwidth...any                                                                                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   Airtel's just fine - 512k bandwidth tops though, not 2 mbps. And its                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   metered (1 to 3 gigs transfer cap a month, so slow down on the p2p and                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   linux image ftp'ing .. there's a well developed sneakernet here) :)                                                                                                                                                                                                             
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > There are quite a lot of Mobile Phone service providers in India and                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > you can select a suitable one depending on the plan and prices that will                                                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   > suit you. The best ones for Chennai/Tamil Nadu is Airtel and Aircel.                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   Airtel, Hutch, etc - lots of them around. ! Hutch is a bit neater / more                                                                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   professional than airtel is, I've found. Make sure your phone is                                                                                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   tri-band GSM, by the way - or you can pick up nokias or whatever for                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   quite cheap here.

   > thanks a lot you guys...it is very very helpful!                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   I find that people are doing their best to help you out in whatever manner possible.                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   But all I have to say is "just come, let us take care of the rest as things come."                                                                                                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   Just play by the ear. Different ppl will always have different perspectives and it will be hard for you to decide which way to go.                                                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   Just come with some uncertainty ! and enjoy the experience.                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   India is very different today. But for the infamous gas connection, you can buy anything and everything with money.                                                                                                                                                             
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   And you can theoretically buy an electric stove and cook too...                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   And ppl are very professional in Chennai and extremely fast too.                                                                                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   So don't get worried. All will be well.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   People in general don't cheat here just because you are a foreigner. If you have an idea about the rates and show that you are not gullible people will immediately start making sense.                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   There are so many foreign students studying in IIT Madras and other foreigners working in IT companies in Chennai and Blore. If you really feel like I could put you in touch with them, but I doubt if you need that.                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   All the best!                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   We are looking fwd to meeting you in Chennai ASAP!                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   regards,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
   Girish

Subject: [Ilugc] Buying a portable external hard - Linux compatibility
Message-ID: <dcd8ccf50612201820l179edb1ch8cee351931cf48f7@mail.gmail.com>

Hi,

I would like to buy a portable hard disk (USB connectible). When I was
looking in the Bazaar, on the box it is written it is compatible for WinX
and Mac (Brands: Buffalo, Logitec). But I would like to have one compatible
for Linux too. Could you please advise if I could format it to use for Linux
and Windows? Or should I have to go for one manufactured to be compatible
for Linux as well? Appreciate your suggestions.

Thanks.
From trshash84 at gmail.com  Thu Dec 21 08:05:24 2006
From: trshash84 at gmail.com (T.R.Shashwath)
Date: Thu Dec 21 08:04:50 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Buying a portable external hard - Linux compatibility
In-Reply-To: <dcd8ccf50612201820l179edb1ch8cee351931cf48f7@mail.gmail.com>
References: <dcd8ccf50612201820l179edb1ch8cee351931cf48f7@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <200612210805.25214.trshash84@gmail.com>

On Thursday 21 December 2006 07:50, Jeff wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I would like to buy a portable hard disk (USB connectible). When I was
> looking in the Bazaar, on the box it is written it is compatible for WinX
> and Mac (Brands: Buffalo, Logitec). But I would like to have one compatible
> for Linux too. Could you please advise if I could format it to use for
> Linux and Windows? Or should I have to go for one manufactured to be
> compatible for Linux as well? Appreciate your suggestions.
>
> Thanks.

Practically any USB storage device will work quite well on a Linux system (at 
least, a reasonably recent system). There are one or two that may not, but 
they are really in the minority. I think that both the brands you mentioned 
should work.

From codeshepherd at gmail.com  Thu Dec 21 13:23:58 2006
From: codeshepherd at gmail.com (Deepan)
Date: Thu Dec 21 14:20:26 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Process log
In-Reply-To: <da6a43120612201853y9dbe14anf6c052d166cccb90@mail.gmail.com>
References: <da6a43120612201853y9dbe14anf6c052d166cccb90@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <1166687638.2737.10.camel@codeworld>

On Thu, 2006-12-21 at 08:23 +0530, Ganesh V wrote:
> Hi!
> 
>    I have a code that I started last night. I generally run the executables
> with the time command, but I didn't and I want to know how long it took to
> run ?? Are these logs stored anywhere on the comp.. ??
As far as I know.. there is no log that will tell u the exact time a
process took. 

I always have time set in my command prompt. It helps me to calculate
the approx time a process took .. provided u dont start it as a
background job. 

May be you can look at var/log/message .. a place where most programs
dump logs. Some other logs from database or other programs might help
you. (provided you accessed database or communicated with other
programs) 

> 
>   I did some searching and found init does some logs. I tried to see
> /var/log/wtmp and /var/run/utmp.. both are binary files !! Anything else I
> can do ??
> 
>   I have not yet shut off my system and it's continuing to get fried.. so
> even session specific methods will be extremely useful.. This was not run
> from GNOME.. i ran it from one of those 6 other terminals that I have
> (Ctrl+Alt+F1) after shutting off xserver for improved performance.

> Dear friends
> 
> 
> I cannot eject my pendrive from Fedora 5. Please help me.

Hi Mathew,

you can find installation details at (quiet short)

us the details.
good luck.

for formatting, JavaScript for attaching behaviours.

From prem at songbirdtech.com  Thu Dec 21 16:22:49 2006
From: prem at songbirdtech.com (Prem Kurian Philip)
Date: Thu Dec 21 16:21:59 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] RE: [OT] moving to chennai - manapakkam (Binand
	Sethumadhavan)
Message-ID: <1728.61.247.255.57.1166698369.squirrel@www.songbirdtech.com>

>>On 21/12/06, Deepan <codeshepherd@gmail.com> wrote:
>> See how Indians welcome outsiders!!!  Is this a common behavior with
>> everyone in India? or only with Indian Geeks?

>In my opinion Indians are in general, xenophobic. It is only urban
>Indians (like ilugc) with modern facilities like Internet access and
>hence a general awareness of the world who aren't.

>Binand

I think Indians are very hospitable to foreigners - specifically to
Caucasians. Actually, this is true of most parts of Asia.

Also, rural India is far more hospitable than urban India.

However, the Indian government is not very welcoming of foreigners -
foreigners are expected to register with a police station on arrival, pay
extra at all tourist spots/hotels etc. This attitude is short-sighted.

If India is to have a vibrant atmosphere where creativity and innovation
thrives then India must be willing to bring in the best and the brightest
into our fold and accept them for what they are with all their cultural
baggage and also make it easier for them to take up jobs locally.

- PK

From sriram at ae.iitm.ac.in  Thu Dec 21 16:41:14 2006
From: sriram at ae.iitm.ac.in (sriram)
Date: Thu Dec 21 16:42:08 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] [OT] the gas 'subsidy'
References: <d2a92d610612182135j3885b18at3450f42449e9205f@mail.gmail.com>
	<413864.13723.qm@web90505.mail.mud.yahoo.com>
	<dfa0f0b60612190932s6cd53850v9557d56990a69005@mail.gmail.com>
	<d2a92d610612191048i51e9e974tfbba0ca97d4a3595@mail.gmail.com>
	<4588A996.4080402@frodo.hserus.net>
	<e0900f3e0612191930j39f99891jea9a8e921e94b460@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <loom.20061221T115822-698@post.gmane.org>

Rajagopal Natarajan <rajagopal.n@...> writes:
> I dont think he'll have tough time with it. Being a non-Indian, AFAIK he
> wont be eligible for the subsidy for domestic LPG. All the paper work we do,
> if i'm right, is for availing the subsidy.

well, actually, the 'subsidy' is a story that the government would like for all
of us to swallow. subsidy, gubsidy, no such thing. the 'subsidy' is with respect
to what is called 'import parity price' which is a price which includes (a
hefty) customs duty. the actual market price of lpg is around $0.3 per kg
wholesale or about $0.4 per kg retail delivered to your house. to get an idea of
what is the customs duty, compare to the private gas suppliers price (or the
commercial cylinder price). what the government is claiming as subsidy is really
only lost customs revenue - which is bound to happen if one fixes both the duty
level and the selling price. yeah, this is waaaaay ot.

sriram

Subject: [Ilugc] inetd/xinetd process

Hi All,

How to find out a particular running service is
belongs to inetd or xinetd (without using chkconfig
--list)?.

Eg:

[scbops@emortapp ~]$ netstat -pat
(Not all processes could be identified, non-owned
process info
 will not be shown, you would have to be root to see
it all.)
Active Internet connections (servers and established)
Proto Recv-Q Send-Q Local Address              
Foreign Address             State       PID/Program
name
tcp        0      0 *:ftp                       *:*   
                     LISTEN      -
tcp        0      0 *:ssh                       *:*   
                     LISTEN      -
tcp        0    180 emortapp:ssh               
::ffff:10.144.221.109:1108  ESTABLISHED -

ftp/ssh belongs to which inetd or xinetd ?.

> [scbops@emortapp ~]$ netstat -pat
> (Not all processes could be identified, non-owned process info
>  will not be shown, you would have to be root to see it all.)

able to see which processes are running under xinetd and which are
standalone services.

hello Bruce Mathew,
                      You can unmount the pendrive using umount
command.Still if the pendrive is mounted then close all the processes that
are using the pendrive.Even if this fails then kill the bash or logout from
the working terminal.Then try to re enter and unmount the pendrive.It will
be unmounted :)
        Please do  tell the error thet you get while unmounting the
pendrive.
